sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: SANSANDING, or Sansandig, a town in the interior of Western Africa, on the north bank of the Niger, in 13° 40' N. lat. and 6° 25' W. long., and included in the “empire” of Segu. It was visited by Mungo Park in 1796, and in 1865 by Mage and Quintin, who witnessed the stand it made against a siege by Alnnedu, sultan of Segu, from whom it had revolted. The population is estimated at 30,000 to 40,000.
